Softmax¶

class layers.activation.Softmax.Softmax[source]¶

Implements the Softmax activation layer.

Softmax is typically used as the final activation layer in multi-class classification problems. It transforms a vector of scores (logits) into a probability distribution, where each value is in the range [0, 1] and all values sum to 1.

probs¶

Stores the output probabilities from the forward pass.

Type:

np.ndarray

backward(grad_output)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass of the layer.

IMPORTANT NOTE: This is a simplified backward pass that is ONLY valid when Softmax is used in conjunction with the Categorical Cross-Entropy loss function. The complex Jacobian of the Softmax is conveniently canceled out by the derivative of the Cross-Entropy loss, resulting in a simple pass-through of the gradient.

Parameters:

grad_output (np.ndarray) – The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s output. In our design, this will be (y_pred - y_true).

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient with respect to the layer’s input.

  • None, since Softmax has no trainable parameters.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, None]

forward(x)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the layer.

Parameters:

x (np.ndarray) – The input data (logits) from the previous layer, with shape (batch_size, num_classes).

Returns:

The output probabilities, with the same shape as the input.

Return type:

np.ndarray
